item.title: Melanie add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I solemnly swear that I am up to no good." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "If you remember nothing else, remember this: Inspiration from outside one's self is like the heat in an oven. It makes passable Bath buns. But inspiration from within is like a volcano: It changes the face of the world." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "Horehound sticks are meant to be shared with friends, don't you think?' She was dead wrong about that: Horehound sticks were meant to be gobbled down in solitary gluttony, and preferably in a locked room, but I didn't dare say so." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "Sanctified cyanide Super-quick arsenic Higgledy-piggledy Into the Soup. Put out the mourning lamps Call for coffin clamps Teach them to trifle with Flavia de Luce!" -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description:
"Vaporized by the sun! Wasn't that what the universe had in store for all of us? There would come a day when the sun exploded like a red balloon, and everyone on earth would be reduced in less than a camera flash to carbon. Didn't Genesis say as much? <i>For dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return</i>. This was far more than dull old theology: It was precise scientific observation! Carbon was the Great Leveler--the Grim Reaper.
Diamonds were nothing more than carbon, but carbon in a crystal lattice that made it the hardest known mineral in nature. That was the way we all were headed. I was sure of it. We were destined to be diamonds!" -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "Diamonds were nothing more than carbon, but carbon in a crystal lattice that made it the hardest known mineral in nature. That was the way we all were headed. I was sure of it. We were destined to be diamonds! How exciting it was to think that, long after the world had ended, whatever was left of our bodies would be transformed into a dazzling blizzard of diamond dust, blowing out towards eternity in the red glow of a dying sun." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Don't Panic." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I'd take the awe of understanding over the awe of ignorance any day." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "All opinions are not equal. Some are a very great deal more robust, sophisticated and well supported in logic and argument than others." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "This is rather as if you imagine a puddle waking up one morning and thinking, 'This is an interesting world I find myself in — an interesting hole I find myself in — fits me rather neatly, doesn't it? In fact it fits me staggeringly well, must have been made to have me in it!' This is such a powerful idea that as the sun rises in the sky and the air heats up and as, gradually, the puddle gets smaller and smaller, frantically hanging on to the notion that everything's going to be alright, because this world was meant to have him in it, was built to have him in it; so the moment he disappears catches him rather by surprise. I think this may be something we need to be on the watch out for." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description:
"Why' is the only question that bothers people enough to have an entire letter of the alphabet named after it.
The alphabet does not go 'A B C D What? When? How?' but it does go 'V W X Why? Z." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "It's quicker, easier, and involves less licking" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a particular disdain with which Siamese cats regard you. Anyone who has walked in on the Queen cleaning her teeth will be familiar with the feeling." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "There's real poetry in the real world. Science is the poetry of reality" -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "You are who you are when nobody's watching." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Friends. They aren’t any such thing as good friend or bad friend. Maybe there are just friend. People who stand by you when you're hurt and who helped you feel not so lonely. Maybe there are worth being scared for and hoping for and living for. Maybe worth dying for too. If that what has to be. No bad friends. Only people you want. Need to be with. People who build their houses in your heart." -- Stephen King

item.title: Melanie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Melanie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Saying 'I notice you're a nerd' is like saying, 'Hey, I notice that you'd rather be intelligent than be stupid, that you'd rather be thoughtful than be vapid, that you believe that there are things that matter more than the arrest record of Lindsay Lohan. Why is that?' In fact, it seems to me that most contemporary insults are pretty lame. Even 'lame' is kind of lame. Saying 'You're lame' is like saying 'You walk with a limp.' Yeah, whatever, so does 50 Cent, and he's done all right for himself." -- John Green

item.title: Melanie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "My thoughts are stars I cannot fathom into constellations." -- John Green

item.title: Melanie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and they’ll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back." -- John Green

item.title: Melanie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "When adults say, "Teenagers think they are invincible" with that sly, stupid smile on their faces, they don't know how right they are. We need never be hopeless, because we can never be irreparably broken. We think that we are invincible because we are. We cannot be born, and we cannot die. Like all energy, we can only change shapes and sizes and manifestations. They forget that when they get old. They get scared of losing and failing. But that part of us greater than the sum of our parts cannot begin and cannot end, and so it cannot fail." -- John Green

item.title: Melanie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What a slut time is. She screws everybody." -- John Green

item.title: Melanie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What is the point of being alive if you don't at least try to do something remarkable?" -- John Green

item.title: Melanie add a quote by John Green
Melanie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "…because nerds like us are allowed to be unironically enthusiastic about stuff… Nerds are allowed to love stuff, like jump-up-and-down-in-the-chair-can’t-control-yourself love it. Hank, when people call people nerds, mostly what they’re saying is ‘you like stuff.’ Which is just not a good insult at all. Like, ‘you are too enthusiastic about the miracle of human consciousness’." -- John Green

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Life is a disease: sexually transmitted, and invariably fatal." -- Neil Gaiman
